message.content:
cs.GT, cs.CE, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG 

The paper discusses a game-theoretic model of scrip systems, which falls under the category of computational game theory (cs.GT). The use of relative entropy to characterize the distribution of agent wealth suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT), but this is not the main focus of the paper. The analysis of threshold strategies and best-reply functions involves concepts from decision theory and optimization, which could be classified under the sub-categories of computational economics (cs.CE) and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The algorithm for computing equilibria and wealth distributions involves techniques from artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG).
